page.title: 14Hurworth Community Centre
page.content: In 1875, the Quaker banking family Backhouse built a large house, Hurworth Grange.It remained in private ownership until the St John of God Order bought it as a training school for novice monks.In 1969, the Parish Council bought the Grange and rented it to Hurworth Community Association for a community centre.They have generous help from Durham Education Committee.Anyone paying the annual fee may join - adults Â£2, 14-18 yrs Â£1 under 14 20p.The staff is a warden helped by two part-time youth leaders, caretaker and cleaners.It opens on 5 weekdays from 8.30am till the last person leaves and at weekends on request.In 1973 a sports hall was built.The centre caters for a variety of interests and offers services such as library,dentist,playgroup and social club.
